Package com.example.celery_sticks.ui.myevents

Class MyEventsFragment

java.lang.Object
androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
com.example.celery_sticks.ui.myevents.MyEventsFragment
All Implemented Interfaces:
android.content.ComponentCallbacks, android.view.View.OnCreateContextMenuListener, androidx.activity.result.ActivityResultCaller, androidx.lifecycle.HasDefaultViewModelProviderFactory, androidx.lifecycle.LifecycleOwner, androidx.lifecycle.ViewModelStoreOwner, androidx.savedstate.SavedStateRegistryOwner
public class MyEventsFragment extends androidx.fragment.app.Fragment
Represents the MyEvents page (homepage) of the app, used for managing events

      public void expandListViewHeight(android.widget.ListView listView)

    • checkIfUserInFirebaseArray

      public Boolean checkIfUserInFirebaseArray(String arrayName, String eventID, EventDetailsViewModel.RegistrationWaitCallback callback)
      Checks if user is in a given array
      Parameters:
      eventID - is the ID of the event
      callback - is used for asynchronous data access, returning boolean of whether user is registered through onDataRecieved
      Returns:
      null if no boolean is returned by onDataReturned

    • getFirebaseArray

      public ArrayList<String> getFirebaseArray(String arrayName, String eventID, EventDetailsViewModel.EventDetailsCallback callback)
      Gets specified array from the database for a given event
      Parameters:
      eventID - is the ID of the event
      callback - is used for asynchronous data access, returning arrayList of userIDs through onDataRecieved
      Returns:
      null if no data is returned by onDataReturned

    • eventClicked

      public void eventClicked(android.widget.AdapterView<?> adapterView, android.view.View view, int i, long l, String eventCategory)
      Opens event details page when an event is clicked
      Parameters:
      adapterView - is the ListView in which an event was clicked
      view - is the event which was clicked
      i - is the index of the corresponding event object in the ArrayList
      l - is the row index of the clicked item provided by the onItemClick function; not used here
      eventCategory - is a string indicating which ArrayList contains the clicked event

    • getEventData

      public Map<String,Object> getEventData(String eventID, MyEventsFragment.EventDataCallback callback)
      Gets data from database for a given event
      Parameters:
      eventID - indicates which event to get data for
      callback - used for asynchronous data access, returns event data through .onDataRecieved
      Returns:
      event data in case of .onDataRecieved failure

    • createEvent

      public void createEvent(String eventID)
      Creates event object to be stored in an ArrayList when new event is added to database
      Parameters:
      eventID - is the ID of the newly created event

    • refreshLists

      public void refreshLists()
      Refreshes UI by calling .notifyDataSetChanged() on all ArrayLists
